ygData.subject: Re: Ideas for a low level newbie?
ygData.msgSnippet: I cant really offer an opinion on the Weapon side beyond try getting a couple of long swords or scimitars to dual weild.  Dual wield REALLY drinks your stamina
ygData.messageBody:
I cant really offer an opinion on the Weapon side beyond try getting a
couple of long swords or scimitars to dual weild. Dual wield REALLY drinks
your stamina at first. Mino axes do more damage but they also weigh a lot
more.
As far as skills and training points go
check this page.. they have a few player guides up and its still being
constructed
www.geocities.com/SouthBeach/Cove/1261

the warrior guide is up at least and it might help you on a few points.

Kelly Pruett wrote:

> From: Kelly Pruett <pruett@...>
>
> Hi all. I've trolled this list a little and you guys all seem to give
> great advice. I was wondering if you could guide a first time EQ player
> on his future...
>
> I'm a level 7 human warrior in Qeynos:
> Max 1H-Slash for my level
> Max Kick for my level
> Max Sense Direction for my level
> 30+ Offense
> 20+ Defense
> 10 or so Bash
> 1 in 1H-Bashing
> 1 in 2H-Slashing (No weapon yet)
> 0 in Hand-to-Hand
> 3 in Bind Wounds (I never use it)
> 30+ Fishing
> 10+ Tailoring (Great combo with the fishing. I make money for the
> patterns)
>
> My question is what skills/weapons should I actively pursue more than
> others?? I've guessed so far just from things I've read on the net.
> Should I ever put more than one practice in a weapon??
>
> Thanks in advance for replies,
>
> Faderic of Ellorisi Mar
>
